column1: One beautiful misummer night in 18— a large
column2: heavily laden steamer was making her way swiftly up the Pacific coast
column3: in the direction of San Francisco. She was opposite the California shore
column4: only a day's sail distant from the City of the Golden Gate
column5: and many of the passengers had already begun making preparations for landing
column6: even though a whole night and the better part of a day was to intervene ere they could expect to set their feet upon solid land.She was one of those magnificent steamers that ply regularly between Panama and California. She had rather more than her full cargo of freight and passengers; but
column7: among the hundreds of the latter
column8: we have to do with but three.On this moonlight night
column9: there were gathered by themselves these three personages
column11: Elwood Brandon and Howard Lawrence. The first was a burly
column13: and the two latter were cousins
column14: their ages differing by less than a month
column15: and both being in their sixteenth year.
